definition: to easily trust/gullible/naïve
light/easy/gentle/soft/reckless/unimportant/frivolous/small in number/unstressed/neutral/to disparage
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
Don't spread abroad the shame of the family, don't believe rumors lightly. (idiom)/Don't wash your dirty linen in public, don't listen to others' gossip.
pinyin: jia1 chou3 bu4 ke3 wai4 chuan2 , liu2 yan2 qie4 mo4 qing1 xin4
containing_words.word: 家丑不可外传，流言切莫轻信

sentences.english: She has practised upon my credulity with huge success.
sentences.chinese: 她利用了我的轻信大获成功。

sentences.english: He is too ingenuous in believing what people say.
sentences.chinese: 他太天真，轻信别人的话。

sentences.english: He has practised on my credulity.
I was once Dr. Fang's ally and supporter because I had been naive enough to just simply take his words.
sentences.chinese: 我曾是方舟子的支持者与同伴，因为幼稚到轻信人言。

sentences.english: Am I supposed to swallow that story?
sentences.chinese: 你们认为我会轻信那个故事吗？

sentences.english: What use were anger and protestations against her silly credulity?
sentences.chinese: 对于她那样痴心的轻信，愤怒和抗议又有什么用呢？

sentences.english: The weak and trusting character of Solon plunged Athens into slavery.
sentences.chinese: 梭伦软弱和轻信的特点使雅典人沦为奴隶。

sentences.english: It's no wonder the Chinese spend their time laughing at the gullibility of certain westerners.
sentences.chinese: 难怪中国要嘲笑某些西方人的轻信。

sentences.english: Only a credulous person would fall for that old trick.
sentences.chinese: 只有轻信的人才会被那个陈旧的骗局骗倒。

sentences.english: You should have a try, don't swallow anybody.
sentences.chinese: 不要轻信任何人，你得亲自去试一试。

sentences.english: Was he greedy, or gullible, or stubbornly blind to the truth?
sentences.chinese: 还是他贪心，过于轻信或者顽固地对事实视而不见？

sentences.english: She is too ingenuous in believing what others say.
sentences.chinese: 她太天真，轻信别人的话。

sentences.english: The manager of the bank was credulous individual named Mr. Fish.
sentences.chinese: 银行经理称“鱼先生，”是个轻信的人。

sentences.english: Scarcely can be credulous those results that had included about written examination, want to rely on oneself.
sentences.chinese: 一定不能轻信那些关于笔试包过的答案，要靠自己。

sentences.english: Credulous people are easily misled by false advertisements.
sentences.chinese: 轻信的人很容易上虚假广告的当。

definition: to listen to information/to get the news/to believe what one hears
to falsely believe/to be mislead/to fall for (a trick etc)
selective listening/to hear what one wants to hear
to take sth to be true
to be cheated/to be taken in/to be hoodwinked
taken in (by sb's deceit)/to be fooled/to be duped
swindler/a cheat
you must not/Please don't.../be sure not to/on no account (do it)
unidentified origin/no-one knows where it comes from/of dubious background
there is no such thing as a free lunch (idiom)
pinyin: tian1 shang4 bu4 hui4 diao4 xian4 bing3

definition: to deceive/to cheat
to be taken advantage of
graceful words, flowery speech (idiom); elegant but insincere words/cheating wheedling/dishonest rhetoric
a swindle/a trap/a racket/a scam/CL:場|场[chang3]
penny wise and pound foolish (idiom)
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
to hoodwink/to deceive/to dupe sb
